message.content:
{"id": "31627", "title": "Bug 31627: DBCS Project causes a core dump when changing perspective after added to the workspace", "description": "Language: Japanese
Build driver: eclipseSDKI20030211linuxgtk
OS: RedHat8 (Japanese: locale jaJP.eucJP), gtk 2.2
JDK Ver.: IBM JDK1.3.1 + SR3

Summary:
DBCS: Perspective change caused core dump after adding DBCS project to the workspace

Description:
Steps to recreate problem:
1. Create a project using DBCS characters (あいうえお(\u3042\u3044\u3046\u3048\u304A))
2. Right-click the project and select Team > Share Project
3. Select the CVS repository
4. Choose "Use project name as module name" and click Finish
5. Select the project in the Synchronize view
6. Right-click on the project and select "Add Version Control"
7. Right-click on the project and select "Commit"
8. Right-click on the project and select "Delete" (Select "also delete contents under /workspace folder name")
9. Change the perspective to CVS perspective
10. Expand the repository and HEAD
11. Right-click on the DBCS project and select "Check Out As Project"
12. ", "OB": "The perspective change causes a core dump after adding a DBCS project to the workspace.", "EB": "After changing the perspective, the eclipse application crashes and produces a core dump.", "SR": "The DBCS project should not cause a core dump when changing the perspective after it has been added to the workspace."}
